Reviews.Title: “No Intergrity”
Reviews.Author: SSRTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, through Orbitz, at the Super 8 Daytona Beach/Speedway Area for July 7th. The rooms were not ready upon our arrival and the key would not work to open the door of one of the rooms. We had to access both rooms through one. Because of this, we were told we would get a credit back on our credit card. After 2 weeks and no credit, I called the hotel and was told they did credit me. After much discussion, they told me to call Orbitz which I did. When the gentleman from Orbitz Customer Service contacted the hotel, he was told we stayed 2 nights and only paid for one, therefore there would be no credit. That was an out and out lie and not appreciated at all. The credit is not the issue here but I am outraged that they can accuse someone of doing that. The Orbitz customer service representative was wonderful, calling the hotel back, running interference, and finally securing half the discount. We will never stay at that hotel again. They certainly have NO integrity.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: Danny L
Reviews.Content: not bad for the price the hotel is old but it is clean the rooms and beds are clean the breakfast is a joke but other than that would stay here aginb for the races just a short 2.5 mile walk to the speedway. just take it as it is a economy stay hotel and you will be happy there is alot worse out there trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs in the room.”
Reviews.Author: StayingAround
Reviews.Content: Mattress stains, looks like urine, and bed bugs. Disgusting!! Avoid the cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs galore!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: terrydonilon
Reviews.Content: I've never had a problem with bed bugs until I stayed in this dump. Now I've got them. Thanks Super 8! The doors didn't work either. Staff was decent. We stayed over 1 night between races at Daytona. We should just gone back to our hotel in Orlando. Next time I will splurge on a nice t-shirt. Dump. Dump. Dump.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL and UNSAFE- even for a Super 8!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bearnard
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, no one really chooses to stay at one of these motels unless there's an advantage, such as price or convenient location. For the February and July Daytona races, availability of affordable rooms near the track is limited. But this motel is THE most poorly maintained structure, let alone paid accomodation, we've ever experienced. First, there was a single lock on the door that, when turned, allowed it to swing wide open. It appeared the prior lock had been broken for quite some time. And the chain --a plastic zip tie. As this room was on the first floor only steps away from the parking lot (where some fans who had a little too much to drink were physically fighting) safety was a concern. We moved the table in front of the door just in case.. The plastic cover for the outlet below the AC was broken off, and we thought that plugging it in may start an electrical fire. The shower and shower curtain were covered in mold, even more so than you would expect in this type of hotel. The drywall and ceiling..use your imagination. Bottom line is that lack of availability and price gouging of area hotels make this location an attractive choice, but the cost you save isn't worth the risk. We couldn't wait to leave, and I think we would have felt safer sleeping in our car at a nearby truck stop.

Reviews.Title: “The Smelly, Damp, and plain Ugly”
Reviews.Author: Superstarr12
Reviews.Content: First off we should have stayed the extra night at the LaPlaya Resort. This place almost triggered an asthma attack and I haven’t had one since I was a little kid. My Fam chose the room based on the pool, walking distance to a McDonalds, and Convenient store. When I first entered the room I was overwhelmed with this smell of mold, damp carpet, pets, and cigarette smoke. After I made several attempts to get a refund the front desk staff (Ms. Kelly whom was very helpful**) restated the company policy but opted to switch rooms. So, we switch to rooms and I went to the local Walgreens to get some stick ups and sleep aid. The next day we didn’t even bother with the continental breakfast we wanted out first thing. Overall I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO MY LOVED ONES, FRIENDS, FAMILY, OR WORST ENEMIES. PLEASE DO NOT USE THIS LOCATION SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSE WHERE.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, broken-down dump”
Reviews.Author: cladagh8
Reviews.Content: No nice way to say this - this property is a filthy dump. No cover over bathroom fan, exposing a thick layer of grimy dust on the fan. Missing face-plate on one electrical outlet which was dangling on the wall. All electrical outlets were either loose or inoperable. The inside of the exterior door was filthy. Electric switch plates were filthy with grime and built-up dust; walls were dirty; poor vacuuming exposes built-up dirt and dust in corners of the room. All in all, disgraceful housekeeping that shows an obvious pattern of neglect. When a fuse blew and the tv and my laptop were disconnected, they gave me another room, which wasn't much better. The cable tv channels provided must be the cheapest package available. Considering that this property is right off I-95 and directly across from the Speedway, it should be a premier facility for Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: HelenI43
Reviews.Content: This motel had many things wrong. Our room had door strips missing that nails were sticking up on the floor. We had to put a folded towel over them so we didn't get hurt. The heater was very noisy.and didn't shut off with the controls. We have to turn off switch near the recepticle that had no cover. The door coming into our room had such gaps that it let in a lot of cold air. We were there at Christmas time during the record breaking cold temperatures. It was NOT clean. We were not able to connect to the internet in our room. We would have had to sit in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly okay if you just need a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RabePaul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while traveling down I-95. With a coupon available at any rest stop or travel plaza, total cost for two people was $45. Room featured air conditioning, full bath, radio, hair dryer, internet access via T1 cable (ie, NOT wi-fi), and TV with 14 channels. The room was quiet, clean, and well-maintained. Staff was professional. The motel is located right off I-95 on Speedway Blvd, just over a mile from Daytona Speedway -- and thus several miles from the beach. Innumerable chain stores and restaurants are nearby. Amenities included outdoor pool and free continental breakfast. If you want to be close to the freeway or to the race track, this motel is as good as any other, and the price was good. Not a place for a luxury vacation, but perfectly fine if you don't need much more than a bed and a TV.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: cairoeyes69
Reviews.Content: First I would like to say I have stayed at this hotel on prior occasions and have never had any of these issues in the past. I called the day before to check availability and was advised the motel had plenty of rooms available. Which is common for off season in Daytona Beach. I also placed a call 2 hours before arriving at the hotel to make sure they had a room with a refrigerator available. I was told they had one room left with a king sized bed and a refrigerator. The woman at the front desk took my name and advised me she was holding the room for me. When we arrived they not only had no rooms what so ever with a king sized bed but the room they ended up giving us was unable to recieve WIFI the t.v. did not work at all and it was at the very end and back of the hotel. There were people hanging out in front of their rooms ( most likely a drug dealer ) and the man at the front desk ended up moving us up 2 rooms to a room that he couldn't get unlocked. Upon entering this room we realized this t.v. also did not work properly. This would have been because they were all jerry rigged. All and all I would say that this hotel has went totally down the crapper. I am a local to Daytona Beach and we have many crappy crack hotels....I believe this one has joined the ranks. I would also not have even stayed here if I would have been alone. I would not have been comfortable at all. Dont waste the money coming to this particular super 8 I'm sure the ones on beachside would have been closely comparable money wise. If I would have known this before hand I would have made reservations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “airport inspection depot”
Reviews.Author: mine9
Reviews.Content: 1st of all they should put in there web site/advertising that this hotel is on the daytona airport landing airstrip approch , 50' above your head not pleased at all with the noise or closesness of watching the under bellies of 737's.we booked as others stop off l-95 arrived walked in & girl looked like what do you wont ? ok l'm here prepaid 2 nights ,1st night 75.00 2nd $150.00 can't get money back to late so don't try, during stay decieded to may-be go to race and stay 3rd night if open, check with girl on desk says yes $ 250.00 a night for sat. l said WHAT 250.00 for a $40.00 night room she said yes its down from $ 350.00 l said good-bye daytona see you in my dust , won't go into no fridge/noise/running toilet these guys are robbing with out a gun during the daytona 500 stay home or in orlando & watch it on tv!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff- Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: karae15
Reviews.Content: We stopped here just off the interstate not aware of anything about this motel. The night staff was super excellent friendly. No issues there. When I went to get in my bed however there was a large wet spot on my bed from the comforter down through the sheets. And yes it smelled. Later on I came to a personal conclusion perhaps someone had there dog up on the bed. Anyway the night clerk immediately brought me a set of sheets and comforter. The next morning the cleaning lady knocked on our door blaming us for the problem. I went to alert the front desk and he informed because of the earlier situation she had been fired and that is why she was mad. I certainly did not think it was her fault but I guess that was their policy. I was not credited for any of this, I guess the clerk assumed I took solice it the lady being fired which I did not because I think she was unaware of the situation and it was just overlooked. Other than that big situation the noise of the airplanes flying over mainly through the early evening hours and morning. This shook the whole room so be aware when it happens.

Reviews.Title: “Id rather have my finger nails pulled out than stay again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: telleaux
Reviews.Content: I dont know what kind of sicko would recommend this hotel. Try walking around a movie theatre with no shoes and you will create the experience of walking around one of these rooms. Keys dont work, rooms are filthy!!!(Dude painting is GOOD), Rust tub, crusty sheets, slimmy lobby and a pathetic I dont care attitude. 250.00 per night is criminal!! wouldnt let my dog sleep there!!! I swear this is the worst. That guy who said thy remodeled is not telling the truth. Its a rat hole!

Reviews.Title: “Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: traveler6245
Reviews.Content: This hotel was certainly NOT as advertised by the Super 8 chain. There was no high-speed internet access (as advertised in all Super 8 brochures) and the Super Start breakfast was laughable. There was no cereal or milk, which are advertised as being part of the "Super Start Breakfast". All they had was bagels and donuts. As for the coffee, there were no cups for coffee--only the thin plastic cups used for cold drinks. And getting credit for the Trip Rewards program Super 8 touts turned into an arguement. Because I had used a coupon for a lower rate, they didn't want to credit my Trip Rewards card. Super 8 Corporation needs to spot-check their hotels. It doesn't matter that they are all individually owned and operated. If they have the Super 8 name on them, they should meet ALL the guidelines of Super 8--beginning with their Super Start Breakfasts and free high-speed internet connection. No excuses.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: NC-BIKER
Reviews.Content: AFTER reserving the room for a two night stay during Bike Week 2007, I read some really bad reviews about the hotel which were written during 2006. We were so pleasantly surprised to see that the hotel had been renovated (though not totally yet we were told by desk clerk) and was clean and fresh. The beds, drapes, carpet, paint, and furniture all appeared in excellent condition. Never saw the first insect and towels were plentiful and new. Bike week is an overcrowded, hectic time for hotel personnel. From our perspective, they seemed to be totally on top of all issues. The only minor disappointment was the lack of a refrigerator or microwave or clock, which the online hotel site indicated were in each room. Perhaps that will be remedied as the renovations continue. The room price was a great value for the event. We will definitely stay here in the future. North Carolina Biker
